definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
to tighten one's belt/to live more frugally

sentences.english: We have to suck in our bellies for a period.
sentences.chinese: 我們得收緊褲帶，過一段時間的清苦日子了。

sentences.english: If food is scarce it's no use complaining; we shall just have to pull in our belts.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不足，抱怨也無用，我們將只得勒緊褲帶。

sentences.english: In days like these, we must tighten our belts and be team players.
sentences.chinese: 在這個特殊時期，我們必須要勒緊褲帶並團結協作。

sentences.english: When the food ran out we had to pull in our belt.
sentences.chinese: 沒有食物時，我們必須勒緊褲帶過日子。

sentences.english: Families are tightening their belts and so should Washington.
sentences.chinese: 許多家庭都在勒緊褲帶，華盛頓也應該如此。

sentences.english: We all have to tighten our belts until your father finds another job.
sentences.chinese: 在你父親找到另一份工作之前，我們都要勒緊褲帶。

sentences.english: Has the combination — tighten belts and raise prices — worked?
sentences.chinese: 勒緊褲帶和提高工資這兩項能共同存在嗎？

sentences.english: Do you remember what it felt like to wear snowpants and mittens on a bright snowy day?
sentences.chinese: 你還記得在大雪天穿着雪褲帶着手套的感覺嗎？

sentences.english: He rarely uses suspenders , since they may chafe him.
sentences.chinese: 他很少穿吊褲帶，因爲會擦得身上痛。

sentences.english: I'd rather wear braces, only the elastic perishes .
sentences.chinese: 我倒寧願系吊褲帶，只不過因爲橡皮筋壞得太快。

sentences.english: A suspender found in a German dugout.
sentences.chinese: 從德國戰壕中發現的吊褲帶。

sentences.english: We've got to tighten our belts.
He reached down past the elastic waistband of his shorts and started stroking himself.
sentences.chinese: 他伸手越過鬆緊褲帶，在短褲裏自摸着。

definition: to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to perform conjuring tricks/to conjure/to juggle
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
